info.name: Spells
info.description: The spells from LP Mills' SEALIGHT.
info.author: LP Mills

description.p: You perform a simple but captivating magic trick. Up to five creatures of your choice within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or find themselves enthralled by the trick For the duration of this spell or until you end it, the target is charmed. While charmed, the target has disadvantage on all Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks made relating to anything other than you and the trick you are currently performing. For the duration, they will have advantage on any Intelligence (Investigation) checks made against you and the trick, but they will be unable to work out how it is done. If the target is immune to the charmed condition, this spell has no effect.

setters.set: a gaming set or cheat's kit

description.p: You produce a truly irritating sound that pierces that disrupts the peace required to properly cast spells. Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save,the target takes 4d4 psychic damage and has disadvantage on saving throws to maintain concentration for 1 minute.

setters.set: a chalkboard and a scrap of metal

description.p: You infect the mind of one creature within range with a virulent psychic contagion. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking 6d6 psychic damage on a failed save. At the start of the target’s next turn, it takes an additional 1d6 psychic damage and up to three creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be considered under the effect of this spell. The target can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn to remove this effect.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd at the start of the target’s next turn.

You cause the brain of one creature within range to swell, causing a debilitating headache. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take 1d6 psychic damage and have their vision and darkvision reduced to 10 feet. If the creature relies on blindsight, truesight, or tremorsense, they take the damage and their sensory range is unaffected.
